revised_title: The Chemical Basis of Blood-Group Specificity in Human Biochemical Genetics
tldr: The author discusses the discovery and understanding of human blood groups and their genetic basis. They explain the ABO blood-group system, the inheritance of blood-group characters, and the presence of substances on the surface of red blood cells. The author also explores the isolation and characterization of these substances, which are mainly of carbohydrate nature, and their importance in understanding human genetics and medical applications.
